decks.notes: This deck focuses on the combination of "Ad Nauseam" and "Angel's Grace" to draw the entire library and win the game. It utilizes cards like "Phyrexian Unlife" and "Lotus Bloom" to buy time and generate mana. "Spoils of the Vault" is used to search for essential combo pieces, while "Thassa's Oracle" is the win condition. The deck also includes cards like "Pact of Negation" for protection and "Simian Spirit Guide" for explosiveness. The land base is designed to support the deck's strategy, ensuring consistent mana and enabling the combo to be executed efficiently.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes prowess creatures like Abbot of Keral Keep and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game swiftly. Additionally, Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recast permanents from your graveyard, ensuring a constant stream of threats.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on efficiency and disruption, aiming to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal spells. The deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total, while cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize help control the opponent's hand. Mishra's Bauble and Cling to Dust provide card advantage, while Kolaghan's Command offers versatility. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion, providing additional value by allowing you to cast cheap permanents from your graveyard.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost efficient spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes cards that disrupt the opponent's hand while also providing card advantage and flexibility. The deck aims to control the board and keep up the pressure by using a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion offers additional value by allowing for continuous recursion of key cards. Overall, the deck is designed to maintain a fast and aggressive gameplay style in order to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing out small hexproof creatures and enchanting them with auras to make them powerful threats that are difficult for opponents to deal with. By utilizing cards like Rancor, Spirit Mantle, and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to build up its creatures quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful, evasive attacks. With a low mana curve and a focus on protecting its creatures from removal spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can mount a defense.

The deck utilizes a toolbox strategy by utilizing combo pieces and tutoring creatures to achieve its win condition. By using cards like Chord of Calling, Finale of Devastation, and Eladamri's Call, the deck can search for specific creatures to combo off with Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion of key combo pieces. The deck also includes interaction with cards like Giver of Runes and Spellskite to protect its combo pieces from removal.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game and stall your opponent until you can assemble the combination of lands needed to cast Scapeshift and win the game by dealing a large amount of damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The deck also utilizes cards like Bring to Light to search for key spells, counterspells like Cryptic Command and Remand to disrupt your opponent's game plan, and powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to gain card advantage and stabilize the board. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents with its versatility and ability to adapt to different situations.

The deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by utilizing a variety of counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats from the opponent. It also includes card draw and card advantage engines to generate value and out resource the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck, while also providing a win condition through its blinking ability. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through incremental advantage and efficient resource management.

The deck focuses on ramping mana quickly to play powerful big creatures like Primeval Titan and Uro. It utilizes Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate extra mana to ensure rapid development of the board. The combination of land tutors like Summoner's Pact and powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle allow for explosive turns where multiple threats can be deployed. The deck also includes interaction like Dismember and Pact of Negation to protect its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to assemble key pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that can either draw cards, counter spells, or disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Remand, and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Scapeshift to generate value and close out the game with powerful finishers. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds an additional layer of synergy and value to the deck.

The deck focuses on ramping up lands and controlling the board, while also having a win condition with Scapeshift. It utilizes cards like Search for Tomorrow and Growth Spiral to ramp up lands quickly, while also having counter spells like Cryptic Command and Remand to control the opponent's plays. The deck also includes creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl for additional value. Overall, the main strategy revolves around ramping up lands, controlling the game, and eventually winning with a Scapeshift combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the board with counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana to eventually cast Scapeshift, sacrificing lands to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a bunch of Mountains to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six for value and card advantage, with Yorion, Sky Nomad as a powerful companion to provide additional long-term value.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board using removal spells and counterspells while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro. The deck aims to stall the game until it can assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage. The deck utilizes a combination of snow lands and Astrolabe for fixing and consistency, with a focus on generating card advantage and controlling the game state.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana. This mana is then used to cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Wurmcoil Engine, Thragtusk, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Oblivion Stone to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an additional layer of consistency and flexibility to the deck.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for the casting of powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional utility and consistency to the deck. Overall, the key concept is to control the game through powerful spells and efficient mana generation.

The deck focuses on creating infinite combos using Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to generate infinite tokens, which can be used to win the game or disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also runs cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six to control the game and protect the combo pieces. The mana base is designed to efficiently support the combo while also providing flexibility to adapt to the opponent's strategy. The archetype utilizes a variety of spells and creatures to maintain consistency and resilience in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.
